results.title: Signs for safety
results.brief_description: Describes clearly the different road signs and their meanings. Divides them into four classes - regulatory, warning, information, and temporary devices. In the Materials Research Laboratory, C.R.B. head office, signs are tested for efficiency, durability and reflecting power. Stresses the need for motorists to recognise and obey the signs.

results.title: Signals without words
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media
results.brief_description: Deals with nonverbal communication in humans and animals. Shows the many ways by which humans and animals communicate without using words — including facial expressions, body posture, gestures, dress, and sounds.

results.title: Sightseeing at home
results.brief_description: The story of television, describing the processes involved from the time the camera records the action to the time it is reproduced on the television screen. An explanation, in simple terms, of the basic principles of television. A telecast is used to demonstrate from the initial recording of the picture by the television camera to the final reproduction of the image on the screen of the television receiver. Explains how light strikes the television plate in the camera, is transformed into electrical impulses, is transmitted through the ether at 4,000,000 impulses per second and finally appears on the screen at the rate of 30 complete pictures per second, thus giving an illusion of movement.

results.title: Sights of London
results.brief_description: Shows well-known streets, buildings, churches, shopping centres and other parts of London, including the Tower, and the Nelson Column, of general interest to the tourist. One sequence shows the procession to celebrate the silver wedding of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth.

results.title: Sight...unseen
results.creator_credit: Paul Davoud, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Science Education Project
results.brief_description: Shows a range of educational activities at the North Rocks School for blind children. Braille music, braille typewriters and other tactile and mobility aids are demonstrated. Suitable for tertiary and teacher levels.

results.title: Sierra Leone greets the Queen
results.brief_description: Royal tour of Sierra Leone by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, and HRH Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh, in 1961; State Drive to Freetown; a military parade and inspection, a Royal Durbar, a State Banquet and the Garden Party given for Her Majesty by Prime Minister, Sir Milton Margai. Visits to outstanding industrial projects and educational institutions and a wealth of colourful pageants and displays are other features of the tour.

results.title: Sidney Nolan: Such Is Life
results.creator_credit: Brian Adams, William Leeson, Ceidrik Heward, Channel 4, Radio-Telefis Eirann (RTE), RM Arts and Waveband Film Productions
results.brief_description: Such is life is a biographical retrospective of Sidney Nolan’s life and work, told in a modern-day journey from Ireland to England, Hong Kong and Australia. Filmed against a background of Sidney Nolan’s past and current projects, it includes the designs for a new opera production for the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden, a large graphic suite on themes relevant to Australia’s Bicentennial during 1988 and exhibitions of his new work in London and Hong Kong.
